servers.description: The AWS Route53 Recovery Readiness multi-region endpoint
The AWS Route53 Recovery Readiness multi-region endpoint
The AWS Route53 Recovery Readiness endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The AWS Route53 Recovery Readiness endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

get.description: Gets readiness for a cell. Aggregates the readiness of all the resources that are associated with the cell into a single value.

allOf.description: The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.
The readiness status.
The readiness at a cell level.
The readiness status.
The readiness status of this readiness check.
The name of a readiness check.

items.description: Summary of all readiness check statuses in a recovery group, paginated in GetRecoveryGroupReadinessSummary and GetCellReadinessSummary.

allOf.description: Summaries for the readiness checks that make up the cell.

parameters.name: cellName
parameters.description: The name of the cell.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The number of objects that you want to return with this call.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: Pagination limit

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: Pagination token

post.description: Creates a readiness check in an account. A readiness check monitors a resource set in your application, such as a set of Amazon Aurora instances, that Application Recovery Controller is auditing recovery readiness for. The audits run once every minute on every resource that's associated with a readiness check.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with a readiness check.
Name of a readiness check.
Name of the resource set to be checked.
A collection of tags associated with a resource.

readinessCheckName.description: The name of the readiness check to create.

resourceSetName.description: The name of the resource set to check.

tags.description: A collection of tags associated with a resource.

get.description: Lists the readiness checks for an account.

allOf.description: The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with a readiness check.
Name of a readiness check.
Name of the resource set to be checked.
A collection of tags associated with a resource.

items.description: A readiness check.

allOf.description: A list of readiness checks associated with the account.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: The number of objects that you want to return with this call.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: Pagination limit

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: Pagination token

delete.description: Delete a cell. When successful, the response code is 204, with no response body.

parameters.name: cellName
parameters.description: The name of the cell.

get.description: Gets information about a cell including cell name, cell Amazon Resource Name (ARN), ARNs of nested cells for this cell, and a list of those cell ARNs with their associated recovery group ARNs.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cell.
The name of the cell.
A list of cell ARNs.
The readiness scope for the cell, which can be a cell Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a recovery group ARN. This is a list but currently can have only one element.
A collection of tags associated with a resource.
Tags on the resources.

parameters.name: cellName
parameters.description: The name of the cell.

put.description: Updates a cell to replace the list of nested cells with a new list of nested cells.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cell.
The name of the cell.
A list of cell ARNs.
The readiness scope for the cell, which can be a cell Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or a recovery group ARN. This is a list but currently can have only one element.
A collection of tags associated with a resource.
Tags on the resources.

parameters.name: cellName
parameters.description: The name of the cell.

cells.description: A list of cell Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), which completely replaces the previous list.

post.description: Creates a cross-account readiness authorization. This lets you authorize another account to work with Route 53 Application Recovery Controller, for example, to check the readiness status of resources in a separate account.

allOf.description: CrossAccountAuthorization
The cross-account authorization.

get.description: Lists the cross-account readiness authorizations that are in place for an account.

items.description: CrossAccountAuthorization

allOf.description: A list of cross-account authorizations.

get.description: Gets individual readiness status for a readiness check. To see the overall readiness status for a recovery group, that considers the readiness status for all the readiness checks in the recovery group, use GetRecoveryGroupReadinessSummary.

allOf.description: The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.
The readiness status.
The readiness at a rule level.
The time (UTC) that the cell was last checked for readiness, in ISO-8601 format.
The time the resource was last checked for readiness, in ISO-8601 format, UTC.
The text of a readiness check message.

items.description: Information relating to readiness check status.

allOf.description: Details about the resource's readiness.
The readiness status.
The readiness at rule level.
The identifier of the rule.

items.description: The result of a successful Rule request, with status for an individual rule.

allOf.description: Details of the rule's results.

parameters.description: The number of objects that you want to return with this call.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.

parameters.description: Name of a readiness check.

parameters.name: resourceIdentifier
parameters.description: The resource identifier, which is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or the identifier generated for the resource by Application Recovery Controller (for example, for a DNS target resource).

post.description: Creates a recovery group in an account. A recovery group corresponds to an application and includes a list of the cells that make up the application.

get.description: Gets recommendations about architecture designs for improving resiliency for an application, based on a recovery group.

allOf.description: The time that a recovery group was last assessed for recommendations, in UTC ISO-8601 format.
The time that a recovery group was last assessed for recommendations, in UTC ISO-8601 format.
The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.
Text of the recommendations that are provided to make an application more recovery resilient.

items.description: Recommendations that are provided to make an application more recovery resilient.

allOf.description: A list of the recommendations for the customer's application.

parameters.description: The number of objects that you want to return with this call.

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: The token that identifies which batch of results you want to see.

parameters.description: The name of a recovery group.

post.description: Creates a resource set. A resource set is a set of resources of one type that span multiple cells. You can associate a resource set with a readiness check to monitor the resources for failover readiness.

allOf.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource set.
The name of the resource set.

The resource type of the resources in the resource set. Enter one of the following values for resource type:

AWS::ApiGateway::Stage, AWS::ApiGatewayV2::Stage, AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup, AWS::CloudWatch::Alarm, AWS::EC2::CustomerGateway, AWS::DynamoDB::Table, AWS::EC2::Volume, AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer, AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer, AWS::Lambda::Function, AWS::MSK::Cluster, AWS::RDS::DBCluster, AWS::Route53::HealthCheck, AWS::SQS::Queue, AWS::SNS::Topic, AWS::SNS::Subscription, AWS::EC2::VPC, AWS::EC2::VPNConnection, AWS::EC2::VPNGateway, AWS::Route53RecoveryReadiness::DNSTargetResource
The component identifier of the resource, generated when DNS target resource is used.
The domain name that acts as an ingress point to a portion of the customer application.
The hosted zone Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that contains the DNS record with the provided name of the target resource.
The Route 53 record set ID that uniquely identifies a DNS record, given a name and a type.
The type of DNS record of the target resource.
The Network Load Balancer resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
The Network Load Balancer resource that a DNS target resource points to.
The Network Load Balancer Resource.
The DNS target domain name.
The Route 53 Resource Record Set ID.
The Route 53 resource that a DNS target resource record points to.
The Route 53 resource.
The target resource that the Route 53 record points to.
The target resource of the DNS target resource.
A component for DNS/routing control readiness checks and architecture checks.
The DNS target resource.
A list of recovery group Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and cell ARNs that this resource is contained within.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services resource.
